DataElement.preferredName: FACT-Th11 Questionnaire Version 4 TH1 How True Past Seven Days Bleed Easily Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how true in the past 7 days they bleed easily, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-Th11 Questionnaire How True Past Week Bleed Easily Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating the quality of life of cancer patients with thrombocytopenia._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual bleeds or bled easily._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating the quality of life of cancer patients with thrombocytopenia.

Concepts.definition: A subscale complement to the FACT-G developed specifically for evaluating the quality of life of cancer patients with thrombocytopenia.

Property.preferredName: How True Past Week Bleed Easily Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.:The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual bleeds or bled easily.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about whether an individual bleeds or bled easily.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on FACT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
